intro: Campomanesia adamantium, commonly known as the "caju" or "carambola tree," is a species native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that can grow up to 10 meters tall, with dense, glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by fruits resembling a star-shaped citrus fruit. The fruit has a tart, acidic flavor and is rich in vitamin C. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
